intro: Wurdastom subglabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf wurdastom, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
